p: After Bitou Bush, the next three most prevalent exotic plant species recorded in our surveys were rare. They were Creeping Woodsorrel Oxalis corniculata L. (89 individuals recorded across all sites in all years), Fleabane Conyza bonariensis (L.) (65 individuals recorded), and Black-berry Nightshade Solanum nigrum L. (17 individuals recorded). Bitou Bush removal did not lead to a significant increase in the abundance of these or any other (even rarer) exotic species (data not shown).
